reviews.text: This iconic symbol of the 1992 games lies in the heart of the Olympic complex and can be seen from miles around , Its a telecommunications tower but in the hands of Calatrevas the designer has created a work of art

The Montjuïc Communications Tower is a communications tower originally built to transmit the 1992 Barcelona Olympics and sits in the Olympic Park.

This striking communications tower was designed by the Santiago Calatrava. Standing at 136 metres high, steel sloping structure represents an abstract image of an athlete holding the Olympic Flame. There's an amazing base with a facade of broken mosaic tiles, in homage to one of the design techniques used by Gaudí.
The views are marvellous, the stadia still impresses but the tower is still outstanding and worth a visit in its own right.

This was quite a useful landmark to navigate by and we went to see it on the final day. It is an interesting shape and must have been designed to be very well balanced as it sits on a very small area.
An amazing communication tower,designed by Calatrava.Placed on Montjuic hill,close to Olympic Stadium.Totally unusual architecture.Definitely worth a visit.

Definitely a highlight of Barcelona.  It is stunning, unique and amazing.  I very strongly recommend making sure you see this while in Barcelona.  I've seen sculpture all over the world - and this stands out in many ways as one of the best.

The Montjuic Communication Tower is an elegant and magnificent sculpture, designed by the famous architect Santiago Calatrava for the 1992 Olympic Games. It is 136 meters high and represents an athlete holding the Olympic flame.

You can found this in the Montjuic area, near the Olympic Stadion, it's very big, you will see it. It's placed in the back of Palau Sant Jordi. The area is an architectural park dominated by the tower. It worth visiting, it's free, and is not Gaudi :).
